Content.Question:
Interviewer: Excuse me … excuse me …
Passer-by 1: Yeah?
I: We’re doing a survey; we’re talking to people about health and fitness … as part of the government’s Healthy Eating campaign …
PB1: Oh right, yes, I’ve heard about that.
I: Good, well could you spare a few moments of your time to help us? It’s just a few questions …
PB1: Yeah, okay. Sure.
I: Okay, so do you know for example how much sugar the average person eats in one day?
PB1: No idea … I don’t know … maybe … three or four spoonfuls, I'm not sure …
I: Right well actually, it’s this much.
PB1: Really? That much? Wow, that’s amazing!
I: Surprising isn’t it? That’s thirty-four teaspoons of sugar …
PB1: Thirty-four? You’re joking!
Interviewer: Excuse me … excuse me …
Passer-by 2: Yeah?
I: We’re doing a survey; we’re talking to people about health and fitness … as part of the government’s Healthy Eating campaign …
PB2: Oh right, yes, I’ve heard about that.
I: Good, well could you spare a few moments of your time to help us? It’s just a few
questions …
PB2: Yeah, okay. Sure.PB2: How much sugar? What in a day? Well quite a lot …
I: Well, it’s this much.
PB2: Uh-huh. Right.
I: You don’t seem very surprised …
PB2: Not really. You see, I’m a dentist …
I: OK, are you? Are you really? Oh right. I see.
PB2: So … no … unfortunately it doesn’t surprise me … I see the results of all that sugar every day
… Bye.
